Asked about the fact that the offense's best work lately came in the final 8 minutes of the Giants game, in which it was otherwise ineffective, Michael Vick said: As long as you find a way to win at some point, that's all that matters. It doesn't matter what happened in three quarters. If you pull it out and you win, enough said. There is a grain of truth there- offensive coordinator Marty Mornhinweg said yesterday that blitzing Michael Vick the way teams have been doing lately is high-risk, that the Eagles feel they will hit a big play eventually.

Few of Michael Vick 's supporters have been as staunchly behind him as Andy Reid . He had a plan and he stuck to that, both on and off the field, Andy Reid said.
